intro: Anisolotus parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered starling plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered leaves and delicate, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically blooms during the summer months, adding a subtle ornamental value to its natural habitat. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas within its native range.
